section.p: For using the HTTPS protocol, it is required to install a Log Agent as described in the product documentation.
As a Operator or OpenStack Operator, you must additionally define communication parameters in the agent configurations before executing the monasca-log-agent.yml playbook that installs the agents.
To configure the agents for HTTPS, carry out the following additional steps before running the agent installer:

li.p: Add the required communication parameters. They must be defined as group variables in the monasca_log_agent_group file.
Open the file with your favorite editor.
Add the monasca_log_api_insecure parameter and the keystone_api_insecure parameter.

By default, both parameters are set to false. This means that HTTPS communication can be used only in case your security certificate is recognized as trusted. You can set the parameters to true if you want to use HTTPS without a valid security certificate.
